modules.description: Parses command-line options from a list of strings, handling flags, boolean switches, and value-taking options. It processes input using a set of predefined rules and returns a structured representation of parsed arguments. This is used to extract configuration parameters from user input in command-line applications.

Parses command line arguments using a list of option specifications, handling both short and long forms with custom actions. It processes anonymous arguments and special cases like the '-' token, working with references and functions to modify program state. Used to configure program behavior based on user input, such as setting flags, accumulating values, or triggering actions.
